lines.text: How many people do you know can cross the Atlantic with only a hunk of salami as baggage?
What do you say we stop all this tree-trimming jazz and hit the road to town?
Oh now, Dealey, you know how I promised Mama about Christmas. You see, while she's trimming her tree in Peoria, I'm trimming mine right here. It's almost as if we're together!
Goshers! Chow! Is sure smelling good, Mr. Dealey-Buddy. Is tasting good, too?
The kid needs a mother. Every kid needs a mother. Somebody to take his troubles to, or somebody to hear his prayers.
Well, he could always bring his troubles to me. I'd be glad to hear his prayers. I like prayers.
You can't be no mother, Peewee. Mothers is female!
I wish you make them let me stay in America, Mr. Big-Buddy, please.
Dondi's talking to the most influential friend of all!

[looking for his GI friends on the streets of New York]
Buddies! Where you are? Is me, Dondi!
